Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @phm87 that is expected behavior (port being used already). The assertion is technically a bug but it is an edge case that happens sometimes in weird error modes. Make a github issue if you would like, or even better, send in a PR to fix it ðŸ˜ƒ

Author: gcharang#6833
Oszy#5734
Content: so it's not possible to use a vanity address with mm2

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: unless i have the seed

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you should be able to use a wif directly as the seed?

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: yeah? i'll try that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: A seed phrase contains many addresses + WIFs, which is why you can't go in that direction. A WIF is a tiny amount of data, a seed phrase contains many many addresses and WIFs

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i am not so sure about that. while it is possible to permute a seed phrase to achieve that, all implementations i know have a hashing function involved

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and you cant reverse hashing functions, which is why you cant go from wif (privkey) back to the seed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c your smart addresses only give 1 addr per coin per seed phrase, but really, there are many derivable change addresses

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: but that is not really accessible to non-developers, I guess. Best answer is from James: `you cant reverse hashing functions`

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the passphrase is only for the master address in that case

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: interesting

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the fact that you derive more from a single privkey doesnt change the fact that there is only one privkey derived from the seed

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: somewhat like using a privkey, and taking the sha256() repeatedly to get other data?

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I know it's more complicated than that, but it seems to be similar. There is a chain of hashed data

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: But only one unique input

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, the derivation paths are not a hash chain, but it all starts with a single privkey

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so any multiple privkeys (addresses) are not inherent in the seed, but rather that you are deriving more keys from the master key

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: each day I understand a bit more

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://medium.com/@jameslee777/adaptivepow-the-solution-to-diff-stranding-of-smaller-blockchains-425609df5563

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how can LWMA DAA mine the next block at the 50000x higher diff?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @gcharang a new -ac_adaptivepow option will be migrating to the various branches. starting a certain date in the future, all new chains that are 100% PoW would default to having in enabled. before that default changing time an -ac_adaptivepow=1 needs to be added. if a chain never wants it they can use -ac_adaptivepow=-1

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: got it

Author: zawy#5864
Content: @jl777c Any thoughts on my last medium reply?  ( https://medium.com/@loganspappy/mediums-not-very-conducing-to-thread-discussion-so-if-you-have-another-venue-you-would-prefer-ac3c535694ee )

Author: zawy#5864
Content: @dukeleto Yes, that TSA article is too long.  I'm trying to make it easier to immediately apply a simple version of it.  But even if I had done that to begin with KMD's situation of > 50,000x hashrate leaving still would not have been addressed by it since I only ever considered a linear reduction in difficulty.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the mult is denominated in seconds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it only activates after about 13 minutes of no blocks, by this time everyone wants a new block ASAP

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so it just goes up crazy fast to make sure a block is found in the 14th, 15th, 16th minute

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if a million times diff stranding, then maybe it needs to wait for 20 minutes, but no amount of stranding survives against elapsed seconds * elapsed seconds

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for chains with many miners, having it not stepped is better

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the use cases that usually get stranded probably have less than 10 miners

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: these are really small chains

Author: zawy#5864
Content: There's no risk of a big miner jumping back on once it drops?  The risk of catastrophic oscillations in normal POW coins with that kind of  drop is .... 100%.  Digishield with the MTP delay makes it worse.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: really it only kicks in after 13 minutes without a block, so it should only be in really rare cases or diff stranding

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we did a test of a 20000x stranding achieved with a Z11
